text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits the revised IRM 1.14.2, Supply Purchasing Program.
The Integrated Procurement System (IPS) has been replaced by the Procurement for Public Sector (PPS) as of October 16, 2017.
As of January

, the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) instituted a requirement that the IRM address relevant internal controls. This will inform employees about the importance of and context internal controls by describing the program objectives and officials charged with program management and oversight. Internal controls are the program’s policies and procedures which

As of January 1, 2017, the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) instituted a requirement that the IRM address relevant internal controls. This will inform employees about the importance of and context for internal controls by describing the program objectives and officials charged with program management and oversight. Internal controls are the program’s policies and procedures which

a. Mission and program objectives are clearly delineated and key terms deﬁned. b. Program goals are established and performance is measured to assess efficient and mission and objective accomplishment. c. Program and resources are protected against waste, fraud, abuse, mismanagement and misappropriation. d. Program operations are in conformance with applicable laws and regulations. e. Financial reporting is complete, current and accurate. f. Reliable information is obtained and used for decision making and quality assurance.
This IRM supersedes IRM 1.14.2, dated August 22,

) The Chief, FMSS and the FMSS Territory Managers (TM) will provide to all IRS business units for supply activities through the Supply Program. (
) The FMSS Office Supply Program Manager provides program oversight and guidance for the Federal Strategic Sourcing Initiative Office Supply (FSSI OS) Program. (
) The FMSS Territory Points of Contact (TPOC) serve as the liaison for the General Services Administration (GSA) and IRS vendor concerns and (
) Business Unit Financial Plan Managers will allocate and account for supply funds. (
) All managers will: a. Designate purchase cardholders to order supplies from approved vendors. b. Determine that requested items are essential for efficient operation avoiding stockpiling.

Program

) The Office of Management and Budget (OMB) has mandated that all federal agencies reduce their procurement expenditures. To support federal in this initiative, GSA has established a government-wide strategic sourcing strategy for the purchase of office supply products and commodities under FSSI OS. The GSA Contracting Officer is the designated official authorized make changes to the FSSI OS Program. (

) The overall goal of the FSSI OS is to offer agencies a fast and effective order office supplies and commodities at greater discounted prices, with prompt and cost-effective delivery, and quality customer service. (
) Beginning in December

, IRS adopted the FSSI OS as the primary method to order office supplies. The supply purchasing process includes ordering, receiving, and accounting for consumable supply items. IRS purchase cardholders must comply with IRS Procurement Acquisition and procedures. (

) The FSSI OS supply purchasing program allows IRS purchase cardholders a. order general office products online or by telephone. b. order and receive environmentally sustainable products. c. anticipate
-hour delivery time. (

) There are two options for ordering supplies: online or phone purchases. options allow purchase cardholders to receive contract pricing. The order not exceed the single purchase transaction limit and must not be included the “Restricted Purchase List”. Vendor contact information and detailed ordering procedures are available in the IRS Purchase Card Guide. (
) Purchase cardholders must make office supply purchases only from the List of Required Sources. Note: If an office supply item is not available from the required source, the FAR, Part

) Each office must establish adequate safeguards and controls to ensure that acquisitions and issuance of expendable supplies are made for official use only. Each office may establish additional procedures necessary for effective stock control. (
) All purchase card transactions must be tracked, as outlined in the IRS Pur- chase Card Guide, and by other methods that may be speciﬁed by the ness Unit Financial Plan Manager. (
